intro: Corydalis mairei, commonly known as the Maire's larkspur, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that typically range in color from pink to purple. The plant features slender, hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often arranged alternately along the stem. Corydalis mairei thrives in woodland and shady environments, preferring moist, well-drained soil. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental flowers and is also noted for its medicinal properties in traditional Chinese medicine.
